messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] student needs a little bit of help
messages.msgSnippet: Welcome, I have not looked at the book myself, but you may want to have a look at: _Samurai Painters_ by Stephen Addiss and G. Cameron Hurst III. At the very
messages.messageBody:
Welcome,

I have not looked at the book myself, but you may want to have a look at:

_Samurai Painters_ by Stephen Addiss and G. Cameron Hurst III.

At the very least, the bibliography and notes should be useful.

Good luck.

Shannon



----Original Message Follows----



hi, i am new here, i have a major interest in samurai history, and
for a college project am trying to find if any samurai did self
portrait drwings/paintings of himself, please mail me back soon if yu
can help.
Kirana

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] student needs a little bit of help
messages.msgSnippet: Kirana, Hi.  One of the most famous individuals believed to have painted himself is the well-known swordsman Miyamoto Musashi.  His (alleged) self-portrait can
messages.messageBody:
Kirana,

Hi. One of the most famous individuals believed to have painted himself is
the well-known swordsman Miyamoto Musashi. His (alleged) self-portrait can
be seen in D. T. Suzuki's 'Zen and Japanese Culture' (last published, I
believe, in 1993 by Princeton in their 'Mythos' series.).


_________________________________________________________________
Get your FREE download of MSN Explorer at http://explorer.msn.com

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] student needs a little bit of help
messages.msgSnippet: yes indeed...a samurai named Takechi Hanpeita of Tosa made a self-portrait,drawn with brush in ink as he languished in jail July 1864, last few yrs of the
messages.messageBody: yes indeed...a samurai named Takechi Hanpeita of Tosa made a self-portrait,drawn with brush in ink as he languished in jail July 1864, last few yrs of the tokugawa shogunate...you can see a copy of his work in the book "Samurai Sketches" by Romulus Hillsborough..hope this helps ur project.
